definition[0]: to be included as part of something
example[0]: The house goes with the job.
example[1]: He had fame, money, and everything that goes with it.
example[2]: Responsibility goes with becoming a father.
definition[1]: to often exist with something else or be related to something else
example[3]: Ill health often goes with poverty.
definition[2]: to have a romantic relationship with someone
definition[3]: to accept someone’s idea or plan
example[4]: Let’s go with John’s original proposal.
definition[4]: to accept someone’s idea, plan etc
example[5]: We’re asking importers to go with the domestic rules and customs.
